results.definition: bring into difficulties or distress, especially financial hardship

examples: The news of her child's illness distressed the mother

results.definition: facing or experiencing financial trouble or difficulty
examples: distressed companies need loans and technical advice
financially hard-pressed Mexican hotels are lowering their prices
we were hard put to meet the mortgage payment
found themselves in a bad way financially

results.definition: suffering severe physical strain or distress
examples: he dropped out of the race, clearly distressed and having difficulty breathing

results.definition: afflicted with or marked by anxious uneasiness or trouble or grief
examples: distressed about her son's leaving home
one last worried check of the sleeping children
